intro: Dicerandra cornutissima, commonly known as the horned dicerandra, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert environments. Its distinctive feature is the presence of horn-like projections on its stems, which give it its common name. Dicerandra cornutissima is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used by indigenous peoples for its purported health benefits.
